channel.title: Matrix Multiplications on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in Matrix Multiplications on Amit Rajan

item.title: Geometry of Linear Equations & Matrix Multiplications
item.description: 1.1 The Geometry of Linear Equations The fundamental goal of linear algebra is to solve a system of linear equations. Let us look at an example of a set of $2$ linear equations in $2$ unknowns: $$\begin{align} 2x-y = 0 \ -x+2y = 3 \end{align}$$ The above system of linear equation when written in matrix multiplication form can be represented as $Ax = b$ where $A$ is a $2 \times 2$ matrix, $x$ and $b$ are column vectors.
